  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>

    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:melt.cup.cam.ac.uk:cahi1:data_97177</entry>
          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_97177</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="fr">Le soleil et les satellites de la terre</string>
            <string language="en">The Sun and the Earth's satellites</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Die Sonne und die Satelliten der Masse</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">O sol e os satélites da terra</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Il sole ed i satelliti della terra</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ο ήλιος και οι γήινοι δορυφόροι</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">El sol y los satélites de la tierra</string>
          </title>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <description>
            <string language="fr">Cette illustration prouve qu'un satellite en orbite autour de la terre peut seulement être visible la nuit quand il est  placé là où il peut réfléchir la lumière qui vient du soleil.</string>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows that a satellite orbiting around the Earth can only be visible at night when it is positioned where it can reflect light that comes from the Sun.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">La Terre</string>
            <string language="en">Earth</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">réflexion de la lumière</string>
            <string language="en">light reflection</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">Lune</string>
            <string language="en">Moon</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">orbite</string>
            <string language="en">Orbit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">satellites</string>
            <string language="en">Satellites</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">le soleil</string>
            <string language="en">sun</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt, daß ein Satellit, der um 
die Masse in Umlauf bringt, nachts sichtbar nur sein kann, als er in 
Position gebracht wird, wo er Licht reflektieren kann, das von der 
Sonne kommt.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra que um satélite que 
orbita em torno da terra pode somente ser visível na noite em que é 
posicionado onde pode refletir a luz que vem do sol.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione indica che un satellite che 
orbita intorno intorno alla terra può soltanto essere visibile alla 
notte in cui è posizionato dove può riflettere la luce che viene dal
sole.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση δείχνει ότι ένας δορυφόρος που 
βάζει σε τροχιά γύρω από τη γη μπορεί μόνο να είναι ορατός τη 
νύχτα όταν τοποθετείται όπου μπορεί να απεικονίσει το φως που 
προέρχεται από τον ήλιο.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra que un satélite que se 
mueve en órbita alrededor alrededor de la tierra puede solamente ser 
visible en la noche en que se coloca donde puede reflejar la luz que 
viene del sol.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Masse</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">helle Reflexion</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Mond</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Bahn</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Satelliten</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sonne</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">reflexão clara</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>
